name: Abby Rivera
nameDescription: A play on 'Nebuchadnezzar' (Morpheus' ship) combined with Abby.
backstory: Dubbed 'Nebby' after she kept the Nebuchadnezzar's blueprints alive in a crashed archive, Abby now pilots the arsenal's long-range comms.

name: Alec Haring
nameDescription: Associating the name Alec with the creator of the Matrix, The Architect.
backstory: Alec earned the Architect tag by rebuilding the command center's logic tree after a system breach, designing every safeguard from scratch.

name: Aleksandr Molchagin
nameDescription: Combining the wise leader Morpheus with the Russian name Aleksandr.
backstory: Morpheusalex brokers calm in the chaos, guiding every Blue Pill mission briefing with Morpheus-level clarity.

name: Alvaro Gil
nameDescription: Combining Alvaro with The Oracle.
backstory: Alvaracle predicts intrusion patterns by reading the data-stream like tea leaves, warning the team minutes before a breach.

name: Bich Dudla
nameDescription: Referencing the glitch in the Matrix (deja vu) with alliteration.
backstory: Deja Vu Dudla spots anomalies before anyone else, flagging repeating glitches that signal a system rewrite.

name: Bob Strubel
nameDescription: Alliteration referencing the choice to remain in the simulation.
backstory: Blue Pill Bob specializes in maintaining stable simulations, keeping Blue Team cover identities intact under pressure.

name: Brandon Badgett
nameDescription: A play on the famous 'Bullet Time' visual effect.
backstory: Badgett Time coordinates slow-mo extraction windows, timing every operation so the team slips past sentinels unseen.

name: Brandon Thivierge
nameDescription: A mashup of his complex last name with the sophisticated program, The Merovingian.
backstory: The Merothiviergian runs elite negotiation protocols, trading favors across the grid with the smooth precision of a high-end program.

name: Bucky The Horse
nameDescription: Referencing the horse program seen in the 'Construct' and the 'Deja Vu' scenes.
backstory: Bucky Byte-Horse is a legacy program within the Matrix, used as a stress-test for physics engines to ensure that even animal movements feel authentic to the inhabitants.

name: Cameron Lynch
nameDescription: Combining Cameron with 'The Construct' (the loading program).
backstory: Cam-struct curates the Construct loadouts, tailoring each training sim to the mission at hand.

name: Casey Snow
nameDescription: Playing off his last name 'Snow' (white) and the prompt to 'Follow the White Rabbit'.
backstory: Casey White Rabbit plants the breadcrumbs, dropping digital markers that guide crews back to safety.

name: Chris Nyberg
nameDescription: His last name is Nyberg mixed with Cypher the character.
backstory: Cyphberg breaks machine encryption in record time, intercepting threats before they can turn.

name: Chris Pence
nameDescription: Making his name sound like a specific piece of software code.
backstory: Chris P. Program is the code surgeon who cleans corrupted modules and restores Blue Team systems on the fly.

name: Dan Bedian
nameDescription: Rhyming his last name with the hovercraft Nebuchadnezzar.
backstory: Dan Nebuchad-bedian oversees the hovercraft dock, ensuring every launch is fueled and flight-ready.

name: Dani Milliken
nameDescription: Based off of Trinity mixed with Dani.
backstory: Trinidani is a precision runner who can ghost through any firewall and land clean in extraction zones.

name: Darrin Jahnel
nameDescription: Assigning him the role of the Operator (like Tank or Link) who dials people in.
backstory: Darrin the Operator keeps the hardlines open, routing every call with razor-focused calm.

name: Debbie Schermerhorn
nameDescription: Referencing the psychic child in the waiting room. 'There is no spoon'.
backstory: Debbie Spoon-Bender bends simulations to her will, warping visuals to distract machine patrols.

name: Dom Favata
nameDescription: A play on 'Dom' and 'Dominion' (control over the Matrix).
backstory: Dom-inion seizes control of compromised systems, asserting Blue Team authority over hostile code.

name: Eva Trimboli
nameDescription: Mixing Eva with Captain Niobe.
backstory: Niobeva commands stealth convoys through hostile tunnels, never losing a crew in transit.

name: Gabe Colon
nameDescription: A play on his last name and the punctuation used to define blocks of code in the Matrix source.
backstory: Gabe Code-lon is the architect of sub-routines, ensuring that the background logic of the simulation never skips a beat during high-traffic events.

name: Glenn Easton
nameDescription: Mapping his name to the directional sectors of the Matrix grid.
backstory: Glenn Grid-Easton is the primary navigator for the Blue Team, mapping out the safest sectors of the city for covert meetings and code exchanges.

name: Graham Macbeth
nameDescription: Blending 'Macbeth' with 'Matrix' for a Shakespeare-meets-digital vibe.
backstory: Macbethrix orchestrates high-stakes heists inside the simulation, scripting betrayals and exits worthy of the stage.

name: Greg Westover
nameDescription: Like an Agent taking over a body in the Matrix.
backstory: Greg Takeover is the counter-agent specialist, hijacking hostile shells before they strike.

name: Harsha Bindana
nameDescription: Mixing his last name with Zion, the last human city.
backstory: Harsha Zion-dana manages the city's defense lattice, keeping Zion secure through every blackout.

name: Ian Ballard
nameDescription: Punning his last name with 'Bullet' from the action scenes.
backstory: Ian Bullet-hard calibrates the ballistic countermeasures that keep sentinels at bay.

name: Jake Hand
nameDescription: Because 'I know Kung Fu' is a famous line involving hand-to-hand combat.
backstory: Jake Kung Fu trains operatives in close-quarters combat inside the Construct's combat loops.

name: James Heffernan
nameDescription: Giving him a title similar to Councillor Hamann of Zion.
backstory: Councillor Heffernan keeps the city aligned, coordinating resources to keep the arsenal operational.

name: Janelle Olsen
nameDescription: Rhyming 'Olsen' lightly with 'The One' (if said quickly), giving her Neo's title.
backstory: Janelle The One is the morale spark, stepping into high-risk missions when the team needs a legend.

name: Jesse Lucier
nameDescription: Giving him the power of the Electro-Magnetic Pulse weapon.
backstory: Jesse EMP controls the pulse cannon schedule, delivering clean blackouts to cover Blue Team escapes.

name: John Healey
nameDescription: Referencing the 'hard-links' required to stay tethered to the Matrix.
backstory: John Hard-link Healey ensures that the connection between a user's consciousness and their avatar is unbreakable, preventing accidental 'waking' during system spikes.

name: John Higgins
nameDescription: Mixing Higgins with 'Squiddies' (the nickname for Sentinels).
backstory: John Squiggins tracks sentinel swarms, tagging every squiddy in the sector before it moves.

name: Jon Keller
nameDescription: Assigning him the role of the Keymaker program.
backstory: Jon Keymaker safeguards the vault of access keys, unlocking hidden doors when Blue Team needs a clean exit.

name: Jory Hutchins
nameDescription: Referencing the 'Hardline' needed to exit the Matrix.
backstory: Jory Hardline maintains the escape lines, ensuring every crew can jack out without delay.

name: Joshua Cantor-Stone
nameDescription: Playing off his last name 'Stone' with the Blue Pill concept.
backstory: Joshua Blue-Stone leads recruitment, offering the blue-pill choice to new allies under pressure.

name: Kari Skinner
nameDescription: Referencing Switch's insult to Neo ('copper-top') regarding batteries.
backstory: Copper-Top Kari runs the power grid, siphoning machine energy to keep Zion alive.

name: Marc Matsen
nameDescription: Blending his last name with 'Sentinel'.
backstory: Marc Matsen-tinal studies sentinel behavior, issuing counter-strategies that outsmart the swarm.

name: Matt Anderson
nameDescription: He literally has Neo's Matrix last name. It had to be done.
backstory: Mr. Anderson maintains the dossier on rogue Agents, always one step ahead of their next move.

name: Michael Shirk
nameDescription: Using alliteration to link him to the Oracle's guardian, Seraph.
backstory: Seraph Shirk guards the Oracle channel, screening threats before they reach the core.

name: Michael Young
nameDescription: Referencing the character 'The Kid' who idolizes Neo, based on the last name 'Young'.
backstory: The Kid keeps his eyes on the legends, documenting every mission to fuel the next wave of rebels.

name: Mike Hamilton
nameDescription: Contrast to the Matrix; the 'Desert of the Real'.
backstory: Mike Real World oversees surface recon, mapping the desert wasteland for safe rebel routes.

name: Morgan Canion
nameDescription: Punning 'Canion' with 'Modding' the environment.
backstory: Morgan Mod-Canion is a master of environmental assets, responsible for rendering the massive, sprawling landscapes of the simulation's outer edges.

name: Nick Brown
nameDescription: There is literally an Agent Brown in the first movie (one of the three original agents).
backstory: Agent Brown leads counter-agent drills, teaching the team how to break the machine's grip.

name: Nick Sprague
nameDescription: Combining his name with the concept of a spreading digital signal.
backstory: Nick Signal-Sprague manages the distribution of the 'comfort' signal, the frequency that keeps Blue Pill inhabitants blissfully unaware of the machine world.

name: Peter Hodges
nameDescription: Rhyming his name with Trinity's famous line 'Dodge this'.
backstory: Dodge-This Hodges handles evasive maneuvers, turning close calls into clean escapes.

name: Ryan Greenman
nameDescription: His last name is perfect for the falling green digital rain.
backstory: Ryan Green Code deciphers the raining glyphs, pulling hostile intent from the Matrix feed.

name: Sean Mullen
nameDescription: Mixing his name with the character Mouse.
backstory: Sean Mouse-en designs lightweight training sims, sharp and nimble like the hacker who inspired his name.

name: Steve Nguyen
nameDescription: A phonetic play on 'Neo' and his last name.
backstory: Steve Neo-yen leads breakthrough drills, pushing recruits to believe the code can bend.

name: Victoria Campbell
nameDescription: Like Rama-Kandra’s daughter herself, her code looks like child’s play but functions as an Exile’s backdoor.
backstory: Vic-Kamala crafts clean, reversible corruptors that slip past machine policy checks, reroute hostile logic, and self-erase without a trace.
